newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Three killed in Pakistan bomb, gun attacks.
newsitem.headline: Three killed in Pakistan bomb, gun attacks.

text.p: At least three people were killed and a senior government official was injured in a bomb attack and two shootouts on Tuesday in Pakistan's central province of Punjab, police said.
One man was killed and four others were injured by a bomb thrown at a motorcycle shop by an unidentified person in the provincial capital Lahore, a police source said.
But residents of the area said two people were killed by the late evening blast.

Earlier in southern Punjab, gunmen killed a prayer-leader in a Sunni Moslem sect mosque at Qaimpur and attacked the Shi'ite Moslem deputy commissioner of Khanewal district, Ali Raza, killing his guard and seriously injuring the official, the police said.
Nobody claimed responsibility for the incidents, but police said the shootouts seemed to be sectarian violence.
Punjab, Pakistan's most populous province, has been hit in recent months by a wave of violence between rival militant groups of the majority Sunni and the minority Shi'ite sects.
